(1 comment)

John Fulton wrote:

> (1 comment)

Yes, John is right about the two differents contexts.

We still have the possibility to run individual/multiple or group of validations
through the command-line[1][2], now that the tripleo-ui is deprecated.

And you guys have the possibility to run them during the deployment itself within
the scope of the inflight-validations[3].

[1] (undercloud) [stack@undercloud ~]$ openstack tripleo validator run --validation-name ceph-ansible-installed
Running single validations
Waiting for messages on queue 'tripleo' with no timeout.

The validation "ceph-ansible-installed" did run successfully
Task 'ceph : Warn about missing ceph-ansible' succeeded, but had some warnings:
Host: undercloud
Warnings: If planning to use Ceph, it is necessary to install the ceph-ansible package on the undercloud

+-----------------------------------------------+
| Success! The validation passed for all hosts: |
+-----------------------------------------------+
* undercloud

[2] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-specs/blob/master/specs/stein/validation-framework.rst
[3] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-specs/blob/master/specs/stein/inflight-validations.rst'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2019-06-04 14:50:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> Yes, John is right about the two differents contexts.
 > 
 > We still have the possibility to run individual/multiple or group
 > of validations
 > through the command-line[1][2], now that the tripleo-ui is
 > deprecated.
 > 
 > And you guys have the possibility to run them during the deployment
 > itself within
 > the scope of the inflight-validations[3].
 > 
 > [1] (undercloud) [stack@undercloud ~]$ openstack tripleo validator
 > run --validation-name ceph-ansible-installed
 > Running single validations
 > Waiting for messages on queue 'tripleo' with no timeout.
 > 
 > The validation "ceph-ansible-installed" did run successfully
 > Task 'ceph : Warn about missing ceph-ansible' succeeded, but had
 > some warnings:
 > Host: undercloud
 > Warnings: If planning to use Ceph, it is necessary to install the
 > ceph-ansible package on the undercloud
 > 
 > +-----------------------------------------------+
 > | Success! The validation passed for all hosts: |
 > +-----------------------------------------------+
 > * undercloud
 > 

I guess this is not a techincal issue but a matter of tastes, hence I am leaving my +2 :D

yet, to me, the warning message did make sense when we didn't have a boolean to enforce the check... introducing the boolean makes me think we want the check to either fail or pass; keeping a warning message seems unnecessary to me because of the newly added boolean

In fact I would go even further and default the boolean to true, explaining in the error message how to disable the check *when not* using Ceph'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2019-06-04 14:50:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2019-06-04 17:02:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 11491, 'date': '2019-06-05 08:01:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Cherry Picked

commit_message:
Add option to fail if ceph-ansible is not installed

If someone is deploying Ceph then they need ceph-ansible.
The warning might be overlooked and the user may end up
with a message about a missing file. If Ceph is being
deployed then we want to make the validation fail the
deployment if ceph-ansible is not installed so that the
user has a better error message to follow in order to debug.

Also, update warning to refer to the ceph-ansible package.

Change-Id: Ic099c61c74abf6da24a2cce899c944e3bf8ce26b

commit_message:
Fixed the egg name of heat to openstack_heat

https://review.openstack.org/606160 changes the change the dist name
to 'openstack-heat' and it needs to be fixed in the os_heat role
otherwise it will fails while installing it.

Added openmpi-devel distro packages as it is need for building mpi4py.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/636297
Change-Id: I2fbb2465f9b4765a87011dfb2c2f65bd27e7b2c9

commit_message:
Fix an action execution controller test

* test_get_all_with_and_without_output failed sometimes failed on
  Python 3.7 with a weird error coming from simplejson library:
  "AttributeError: 'MagicMock' object has no attribute 'items'"
  It seems like that the mock object used in the test got broken
  magically sometimes after the first use. So splitting the test
  into two solved the issue.

Change-Id: Ic2e0ad75b666dd4c258764018dd68d0ef0b032a8
(cherry picked from commit 9a60cd62d2d3ebd7706cdc4dec9f3d6f5ab5c9f8)

commit_message:
Make all functional tests reusable by other projects

In I73f9dacd912331d209a6fa04eaf5591d94d720f2 the functional-py36
was made reusable by other projects by adding explicitly adding
nova to projects and explicitly stating the zuul work dir.

This change adds the other functional jobs.

Change-Id: Iaf2c1f87ae4a4ec2ecf6cc19220c6d15f8580321
Story: 2005562

(8 comments)

Great contribution Kasper! I added several questions and remarks. Please, review them.

Also, according to Cassandra upgrade guide:

> Upgrade order matters

And:

> Upgrade the seed nodes within a datacenter first

How do we approach this problem?

[1] https://docs.datastax.com/en/upgrade/doc/upgrade/ddac/upgdDDACMinor51x.html'}, {'account_id': 28695, 'date': '2019-04-12 08:26:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Also, please link reference Cassandra upgrade procedure in the commit message and describe implemented procedure briefly (preferable in points).'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2019-04-12 08:34:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

@Bartosz, @Kasper, another question, I'm very curious how do you deal with guest agent upgrade in Samsung?"}, {'account_id': 29995, 'date': '2019-04-12 09:03:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 28695, 'date': '2019-04-12 09:11:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> @Bartosz, @Kasper, another question, I'm very curious how do you
 > deal with guest agent upgrade in Samsung?

We have not approached the problem of GA upgrade yet, but it is present in our roadmap and definitely worth implementing in the future. Many people asked about it during the last OpenStack Summit.

Temporarily, the only solution that I see is to use existing Trove features that cause VM rebuild with a new datastore image hosting upgraded version of GA software, e.g., database backups or database upgrades.

Having both single-instance and clustered deployment options in place with support for backups (that we are going to upstream soon) and rolling upgrades (that we are upstreaming at the moment) should be sufficient in most situations. There are, of course, certain aspects of database upgrade that require a closer look, e.g. coupling between GA version and datastore version.

Could you please take a look at change: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/642050/ - it introduces a multi-version framework into Trove."}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2019-04-12 11:28:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> > @Bartosz, @Kasper, another question, I'm very curious how do you
 > > deal with guest agent upgrade in Samsung?
 > 
 > We have not approached the problem of GA upgrade yet, but it is
 > present in our roadmap and definitely worth implementing in the
 > future. Many people asked about it during the last OpenStack
 > Summit.
 > 
 > Temporarily, the only solution that I see is to use existing Trove
 > features that cause VM rebuild with a new datastore image hosting
 > upgraded version of GA software, e.g., database backups or database
 > upgrades.
 > 
 > Having both single-instance and clustered deployment options in
 > place with support for backups (that we are going to upstream soon)
 > and rolling upgrades (that we are upstreaming at the moment) should
 > be sufficient in most situations. There are, of course, certain
 > aspects of database upgrade that require a closer look, e.g.
 > coupling between GA version and datastore version.
 > 
 > Could you please take a look at change: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/642050/
 > - it introduces a multi-version framework into Trove.

Thanks for sharing those information. Guest image upgrade is also one of our requirements before rolling out Trove in our public cloud. I will definitely take a close look after finishing the devstack improvement and some other enhancement in our TODO list."}, {'account_id': 28695, 'date': '2019-04-12 12:08:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

This patch adds support for upgrading Cassandra datastore - both single
instance cluster and multiple-node cluster.

It is achievied in a similar way to MySQL/Mariadb. The key difference
is draining nodes before upgrade and upgrading sstables after succesful
volume mounting operation.

Cassandra upgrade steps have been taken from
https://docs.datastax.com/en/upgrade/doc/upgrade/ddac/upgdDDACMinor51x.html

In case of trove it looks as follows:
For each node do:
    + enter restart mode
    + drain and stop node
    + preserve configuration files and home directory
    + unmount volume
    + create instance with new datastore version
    + mount volume
    + restore configuration and home directory
    + start Cassandra
    + upgrade sstables

Because we need to upgrade seeds first there is an additional parameter
in rolling_upgrade_cluster function - a function which is used to so
sort nodes in proper order.

commit_message:
Add Cassandra datastore upgrade

This patch adds support for upgrading Cassandra datastore - both single
instance cluster and multiple-node cluster.

It is achievied in a similar way to MySQL/Mariadb. The key difference
is draining nodes before upgrade and upgrading sstables after succesful
volume mounting operation.

Cassandra upgrade steps have been taken from
https://docs.datastax.com/en/upgrade/doc/upgrade/ddac/upgdDDACMinor51x.html

In case of trove it looks as follows:
For each node do:
    + enter restart mode
    + drain and stop node
    + preserve configuration files and home directory
    + unmount volume
    + create instance with new datastore version
    + mount volume
    + restore configuration and home directory
    + start Cassandra
    + upgrade sstables

Because we need to upgrade seeds first there is an additional parameter
in rolling_upgrade_cluster function - a function which is used to so
sort nodes in proper order.

Story: #2005410
Task: #30426
Co-Authored-By: Przemysaw Godek <p.godek@partner.samsung.com>
Change-Id: I9f25606d51b35e264a8c36f9524ae57b0a5780d0
Signed-off-by: Kasper Hasior <k.hasior@samsung.com>

commit_message:
[redhat] Added python3 packages for os_tempest role

It includes _tempest_plugin_distro_packages_python2
and _tempest_plugin_distro_packages_python3 var for including
python2 and python3 sub packages.

Needed to invert the logic for ansible_distribution_version
due to this ansible issue:
https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/50141

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ie3169abcd62a9ac97ae78db0d918cccee5cf1630

This goal is to implement the process set out in the 2018-10-24 Python
Update Process TC resolution[1], for the Train cycle to ensure unit
testing is in place for all of the Tested Runtimes for Train[2].
In practice, this generally means adding unit tests for Python 3.7 and dropping
unit tests for Python 3.5. Using the Zuul template for Train will ensure that
all projects that support Python3 will be tested against the agreed runtime
versions, and make it easier to update them in future.

commit_message:
Update Python 3 test runtimes for Train

This goal is to implement the process set out in the 2018-10-24 Python
Update Process TC resolution[1], for the Train cycle to ensure unit
testing is in place for all of the Tested Runtimes for Train[2].
In practice, this generally means adding unit tests for Python 3.7 and dropping
unit tests for Python 3.5. Using the Zuul template for Train will ensure that
all projects that support Python3 will be tested against the agreed runtime
versions, and make it easier to update them in future.

[1]https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20181024-python-update-process.html
[2]https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Change-Id: I018f79c6819ead9ffee777addb7ba6b369304962
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/641878/

commit_message:
Fix ssl.yaml generating GaneshaInternal in the endpoint map

The GaneshaInternal configured in the endpoint map is used by
the Ganesha service that front-ends CephFS with Manila. It cannot be
a hostname, it must be an IP Address always. See [1]

Closes-Bug: #1824421
[1] https://github.com/nfs-ganesha/nfs-ganesha/blob/af26bf4/src/config_samples/config.txt#L43
Change-Id: I9eefa5f145ab5b17a4d93e96f4aad35d3e069382

subject: Ignore python 3.4 and 3.5 for sphinx
messages:
[{'account_id': 27068, 'date': '2019-05-24 02:37:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2019-05-24 02:59:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

sphinx still works on py2 though, while we are moving away from py27, we are not forcing anything yet to my knowlege'}, {'account_id': 27068, 'date': '2019-05-24 03:01:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Thanks for reviewing. I didn't touch the py27 version of sphinx."}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2019-05-24 03:05:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

True, I missed that, I would say that gr us also useful for packagers, further, some projects (thinking mainly of swift) may want to support older versions of python.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-05-24 03:52:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

We're not ready for this yet but it's on the to-do list for this cycle once we have the tooling changes in place.

Are you hitting an issue that this fixes?  if so can you explain it and we can perhaps find an alternate work around or make an exception for this change"}, {'account_id': 27068, 'date': '2019-05-25 01:40:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thanks Matthew and Tony for the reviews. I don't have any issue with this. It's just that when trying to fix sphinx issue in Searchlight [1] by selecting python version, I think It'd better now use py3.6 and above so we don't have to change it later.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/659501/"}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-05-28 01:29:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Thanks Matthew and Tony for the reviews. I don't have any issue
 > with this. It's just that when trying to fix sphinx issue in
 > Searchlight [1] by selecting python version, I think It'd better
 > now use py3.6 and above so we don't have to change it later.
 > 
 > [1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/659501/

Oh :(

So cards on the table, what you want to do is the right thing.  However we (the requirements team) are't ready to make the changes needed to remove py<3.6.  So we're kinda at an impasse .... 659501 can't merge yet and we can't merge this yet :(

With all the constraints work on our plate ATM I doubt we'll get to the work you need anytime soon, I'm guessing it'll be around m2

Are you willing to update 659501 to say <3.4, and then add a patch on top that says <3.6 (yes that's fixing it later but with the review there it wont be forgotten)"}, {'account_id': 27068, 'date': '2019-05-28 01:38:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Ignore python 3.4 and 3.5 for sphinx

Since the minimum supported version of python in Train is 3.6, I
think we can saftly ignore 3.4 and 3.5.

Change-Id: I3e91d25cc6f9071fcc7314cfd34152c5f99a4db6

commit_message:
WIP: Add ONOS SONA Chart

This PS is to use ONOS SONA(Simplified Overlay Network Architecture)
for neutron backend (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/481225/6).

SONA is an optimized tenant network virtualization service.  Basically,
it is a set of ONOS applications which provides OpenStack Neutron ML2
mechanism driver and L3 service plugin.
https://wiki.onosproject.org/x/BIdI

Change-Id: Ic7242b9a56fa833216cc913e985128e630ed2ce1

commit_message:
Add microversion support in scenario tests

Scenario test call multiple service APIs within
same test. Many service like compute, volume etc
support microversion but scenario test does not
support microversion yet.

This commit adds the microversion support in scenario tests
so that they will be able to set multiple service microversion
at the same time.

Change-Id: I446e082331c9d1b37c40c9eeb896eec222c3c045

* test_get_all_with_and_without_output failed sometimes failed on
  Python 3.7 with a weird error coming from simplejson library:
  "AttributeError: 'MagicMock' object has no attribute 'items'"
  It seems like that the mock object used in the test got broken
  magically sometimes after the first use. So splitting the test
  into two solved the issue.

Change-Id: Ic2e0ad75b666dd4c258764018dd68d0ef0b032a8
'}]
commit_message:
Fix an action execution controller test

* test_get_all_with_and_without_output failed sometimes failed on
  Python 3.7 with a weird error coming from simplejson library:
  "AttributeError: 'MagicMock' object has no attribute 'items'"
  It seems like that the mock object used in the test got broken
  magically sometimes after the first use. So splitting the test
  into two solved the issue.

Change-Id: Ic2e0ad75b666dd4c258764018dd68d0ef0b032a8

Add parameter `num_pcie_ports` to specify the number of PCIe ports an

Libvirt allows a custom number of PCIe ports (pcie-root-port controllers) a

commit_message:
Add parameter for `libvirt/num_pcie_ports`

Add parameter `num_pcie_ports` to specify the number of PCIe ports an
instance will get.
Libvirt allows a custom number of PCIe ports (pcie-root-port controllers) a
target instance will get. Some will be used by default, rest will be available
for hotplug use.

Change-Id: I16732c9d6013112381cfad999540dd41ec3d7ba3

commit_message:
Add parameter for `compute/live_migration_wait_for_vif_plug`

Add parameter `live_migration_wait_for_vif_plug` to
whether to wait for ``network-vif-plugged`` events before
starting guest transfer.

Also fixes some allignment in compute.pp

Change-Id: I0048d1f57eeb3418b52f225f87810ea1a7250a0f
(cherry picked from commit 282ef4e391273a62582b42908bced1539d984a33)

commit_message:
Remove some deprecated identity options

Below options are deprecated on 2015, so it's safe to delete them now.
  * identity.admin_username
  * auth.admin_tenant_name
  * identity.admin_tenant_name
  * identity.admin_password
  * identity.admin_domain_name

Change-Id: I9cfd3b93f032e6816661e16cbb319af507835997

commit_message:
Dropping the py35 testing

All the integration testing has been moved to
Bionic now[1] and py3.5 is not tested runtime for
Train or stable/stein[2].

As per below ML thread, we are good to drop the py35
testing now:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005097.html

[{'created': '2019-05-21 13:23:00.000000000', 'message': "Remove n-cells, n-net and n-cauth

Remove nova cells v1 support, which also allows/necessitates removing
support for nova networks (which was only supported with cells v1) and
nova-consoleauth (which was required by cells v1 but is unnecessary
otherwise).

The Depends-On isn't really necessary, but it's here to make sure this
doesn't merge until we _really_ have killed cells v1.

I honestly expected this patch would be bigger.

commit_message:
Remove n-cells, n-net and n-cauth

Remove nova cells v1 support, which also allows/necessitates removing
support for nova networks (which was only supported with cells v1) and
nova-consoleauth (which was required by cells v1 but is unnecessary
otherwise).

The Depends-On isn't really necessary, but it's here to make sure this
doesn't merge until we _really_ have killed cells v1.

I honestly expected this patch would be bigger.

Change-Id: I90316208d1af42c1659d3bee386f95e38aaf2c56
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Depends-On: Ib0e0b708c46e4330e51f8f8fdfbb02d45aaf0f44

Fix UT error

Now post or delete messages with ids, we should transform ids=['11111,2222,3333,444,555']
from request url to list ids=['1111', '2222', '3333', '4444'].

Thanks Eric, Doug. Changing this to the stable/rocky.'}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2019-06-05 00:42:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I don't know how to switch the current modification to stable/rocky on the current patch, so I submitted a new patch for stable/rocky. If there is any change, please leave a comment to facilitate subsequent learning and use. Thank you.

New link: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/663178/"}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2019-06-05 00:45:05.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

If have any suggestion, I can receive.'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2019-06-05 00:51:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I don't know how to switch the current modification to stable/rocky
 > on the current patch, so I submitted a new patch for stable/rocky.
 > If there is any change, please leave a comment to facilitate
 > subsequent learning and use. Thank you.
 > 
 > New link: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/663178/

I don't think there's any way to change what branch a change is proposed to -- I think abandon and propose new change is the only way."}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2019-06-05 01:30:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I don't think there's any way to change what branch a change is
> proposed to -- I think abandon and propose new change is the only
> way.

Thanks for your reply, I got it."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-06-05 02:35:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I haven't tried it, but it *might* work to 
- rebase onto stable/rocky
- git review specifying stable/rocky as the target.

Anyway, the way you did it is totally appropriate. Thanks and sorry for the churn."}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2019-06-05 03:41:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I haven't tried it, but it *might* work to
 > - rebase onto stable/rocky
 > - git review specifying stable/rocky as the target.
 > 
 > Anyway, the way you did it is totally appropriate. Thanks and sorry
 > for the churn.

Thanks Eric. I will try to simulate a scene in our own environment later."}]

Change floatingip to floating IP

commit_message:
Install os_tempest deps from master

Since os_tempest and its dependencies are branches but for
consuming in Tripleo CI and tests tempest stuff, we needs
latest bits from master.

Change-Id: Id53de9e0d5f8b40fcc8c520360e8e922a5c07676
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-04 04:27:25.000000000', 'message': "Fix tripleo::haproxy::stats to be more correct and flexible

In this change we do three things:
1) We make the class parameter 'ip' also be a list so that multiple
   bind addresses are possible
2) We remove the hard coded 1993 and move it to a parameter
3) Instead of passing only the controller_virtual_ip as the only bind
   address on all controllers which makes no sense (see linked LP)
   we also bind to the IP specified in the hiera key
   'tripleo::haproxy::haproxy_stats_bind_address'.

Tested this change with the accompanying THT patch and correctly
got the haproxy stats on a custom network (internal_api and the
controller vip):

listen haproxy.stats
  bind fd00:fd00:fd00:2000::16:1993 transparent
  bind 192.168.24.15:1993 transparent
  mode http
  stats enable
  stats uri /
  stats auth admin:password

I did not remove the controller_virtual_ip binding as that might be
a breaking change for operators. We could think about deprecating it
and removing it eventually.

Related-Bug: #1830334
Change-Id: Iab5f11c3065ff34a3543621554e7f05161d069f2
(cherry picked from commit e76519d2c8324e71db1871e2a9219eb66d0ce5c4)
(cherry picked from commit ef577909d6b5b0db6ea829e2325aed989d91ba35)
(cherry picked from commit 73fdcc0d62c74deee8a67cd28364cc5e4b42dea8)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix tripleo::haproxy::stats to be more correct and flexible

In this change we do three things:
1) We make the class parameter 'ip' also be a list so that multiple
   bind addresses are possible
2) We remove the hard coded 1993 and move it to a parameter
3) Instead of passing only the controller_virtual_ip as the only bind
   address on all controllers which makes no sense (see linked LP)
   we also bind to the IP specified in the hiera key
   'tripleo::haproxy::haproxy_stats_bind_address'.

Tested this change with the accompanying THT patch and correctly
got the haproxy stats on a custom network (internal_api and the
controller vip):

listen haproxy.stats
  bind fd00:fd00:fd00:2000::16:1993 transparent
  bind 192.168.24.15:1993 transparent
  mode http
  stats enable
  stats uri /
  stats auth admin:password

I did not remove the controller_virtual_ip binding as that might be
a breaking change for operators. We could think about deprecating it
and removing it eventually.

Related-Bug: #1830334
Change-Id: Iab5f11c3065ff34a3543621554e7f05161d069f2
(cherry picked from commit e76519d2c8324e71db1871e2a9219eb66d0ce5c4)
(cherry picked from commit ef577909d6b5b0db6ea829e2325aed989d91ba35)
(cherry picked from commit 73fdcc0d62c74deee8a67cd28364cc5e4b42dea8)

commit_message:
Add parameters necessary to use a remote Ganesha service

The CephFS backend can use SSH to configure Ganesha even when this
is deployed on remote servers. This change adds the parameters
necessary to configure Manila with the appropriate credentials to
connect via SSH to the remote server.

Change-Id: I31fff6a1b6fede860b8aaee0079183924e8b31d6
(cherry picked from commit 80a8df65930fee17ed5c736e966f06242ff7e065)

commit_message:
Add parameters necessary to use a remote Ganesha service

The CephFS backend can use SSH to configure Ganesha even when this
is deployed on remote servers. This change adds the parameters
necessary to configure Manila with the appropriate credentials to
connect via SSH to the remote server.

commit_message:
Update master for stable/stein

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/stein.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/stein.

Change-Id: I6fbfa3862a6cc4b9135f33144e096634d44d3ef8
Sem-Ver: feature

subject: [k8s]Using restart for k8s systemd service
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-22 21:38:15.000000000', 'message': '[k8s]Using restart for k8s systemd service

To repair a master node, we would like to leverage the Heat mark
unhealthy feature to mark the broken master node unhealthy and
then calling Heat stack update to rebuild the master. But with
that way, Heat will keep the original IP address of the node
and which cause kubelet needs a restart to be ready.

Task: 33470
Story: 2004782

Change-Id: I89265e44035b755465a92ae078a10780859d2d8e
'}]
commit_message:
[k8s]Using restart for k8s systemd service

To repair a master node, we would like to leverage the Heat mark
unhealthy feature to mark the broken master node unhealthy and
then calling Heat stack update to rebuild the master. But with
that way, Heat will keep the original IP address of the node
and which cause kubelet needs a restart to be ready.

Task: 33470
Story: 2004782

Change-Id: I89265e44035b755465a92ae078a10780859d2d8e

commit_message:
Fix creating plan with invalid provider and no parameters

When we create a plan with using invalid provider, it return
success if we do not specify parameters. This patch will fix
it.
Closes-Bug: #1829163

Change-Id: I9755949343b73702fd00f5407b5d01b82c4a0963

commit_message:
Sync Sphinx requirement

Sync sphinx dependency with global requirements. It caps python 2 since
sphinx 2.0 no longer supports Python 2.7.

Change-Id: I3e7d661779703102184774b664eab89272560f2b
Closes-Bug: #1831518

commit_message:
Fix import error when client module is not exist

When we do not want use some plugins that require some specify client,
it is allowed not install the client moduele. But currently, karbor will
throw ImportError. This patch fix it.

commit_message:
Add kill hooks for external processes

This patch adds possibility to configure kill hooks used to kill
external processes, like dnsmasq or keepalived.

Change-Id: I29dfbedfb7167982323dcff1c4554ee780cc48db
Closes-Bug: #1825943

commit_message:
Remove tempest tests entry point

This commit removes the tempest tests entry point from setup.cfg.
Tempest tests were already removed by this commit[0]. So, we don't need
to have it.

[0] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/657793/

Remove tripleo-ui items from the undercloud install

We've retired the tripleo-ui repository so we need to remove the ui
configurations for the undercloud.

Related-Bug: #1831478

commit_message:
Blacklist python-cinderclient 4.0.0

This release of the Cinder client broke support for the v3
volume-transfer APIs unless microversion 3.55 or higher was requested.
Depends-On https://review.opendev.org/#/c/587877/

Change-Id: I917b0a47896fcac3edab4b8e55bde71a0aa55632

commit_message:
Dropping the py35 testing

All the integration testing has been moved to
Bionic now[1] and py3.5 is not tested runtime for
Train or stable/stein[2].

As per below ML thread, we are good to drop the py35
testing now:

It is similar to flake8 a generic static code linter
and not necessary for building a binary distribution
of OpenStack, so enforcing a g-r consistent version
seems to be slightly over the top

Not having this in the blacklist on Pike prevents projects from
excluding the broken 0.6.0 release. Adding an exclusion for 0.6.0 in

commit_message:
Move bandit into the linters blacklist

It is similar to flake8 a generic static code linter
and not necessary for building a binary distribution
of OpenStack, so enforcing a g-r consistent version
seems to be slightly over the top

Not having this in the blacklist on Pike prevents projects from
excluding the broken 0.6.0 release. Adding an exclusion for 0.6.0 in
global-requirements would require projects to exclude it.

Change-Id: I3907050a3aaab9d32f9b71c14c47212ba793b58d

commit_message:
Treat null admin_state_up as False

This patch changes the to_dict function for the API obj, if the user
pass null into admin_state_up to request. We treat it as False.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/583413/
Story: 2002927
Task: 22914
Change-Id: Iab79b422983f6b2124837fd9ebe60a85b0516f41
(cherry picked from commit 0e13939769c8b6eccfa1553bc049ede75082149d)

commit_message:
Unblock gate failures

There are a few issues causing all gate runs to fail that are addressed
in this patch.

Update constraints to match global requirements:

There are a few local requirements that conflict with what is now in
upstream global-requirements. This updates sphinx to match the
constrained versions due to incompatibility with py2 and uncaps
jsonschema.

Update handling for falcon 2.0.0 behavior changes:

The 2.0.0 release of falcon changed the default values for two request
query parsing options that would cause failures due to unexpected
results. This sets those options to their previous defaults to maintain
compatibility across 2.0.0 and pre-2.0.0 versions of the package.
Lower constraint version raised to 1.1.0 where the options were
introduced.

There are additional integration test failures with Falcon 2.0.0 that
were due to changes in the subscription URL path.

Closes-bug: #1830903

Requirements and upper constraints not enforced in some tox targets:

The docs and api-ref tox targets were not setting the right dependencies
or the upper constraints to use for pip installs. Also updates the
constraints to the newer preferred static redirect URL maintained by the
release team.

Co-authored-by: wanghao <sxmatch1986@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I19c5363878c629a04e1be902c865ee7cea92dcd9
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

start building our own images.

commit_message:
Start using importlib for Python 3.x

The imp module is deprecated since a while and the load_source
method has been removed from docs because broken [1][2]
Unfortunately we have to use it until Python 2.x dies, but we
can start using importlib for Python 3.3 or higher.

[1] https://bugs.python.org/issue14551
[2] https://mail.python.org/pipermail/python-ideas/2014-December/030265.html

Change-Id: I318d0bea8221023f20ad84a06234cca3fdd31657

It may happen that subnet is connected to dvr router using IP address
different than subnet's gateway_ip.
So in br-tun arp to dvr router's port should be dropped instead of
dropping arp to subnet's gateway_ip (or mac in case of IPv6).

Closes-bug: #1831575
"}]
commit_message:
[DVR] Block ARP to dvr router's port instead of subnet's gateway

It may happen that subnet is connected to dvr router using IP address
different than subnet's gateway_ip.
So in br-tun arp to dvr router's port should be dropped instead of
dropping arp to subnet's gateway_ip (or mac in case of IPv6).

Change-Id: Ida6b7ae53f3fc76f54e389c5f7131b5a66f533ce
Closes-bug: #1831575

commit_message:
Blacklist bandit 1.6.0 and cap Sphinx on Python2

There's a regression[0] in bandit 1.6.0 which causes bandit to stop
respecting excluded directories, and our tests throw a bunch of
violations. Blacklist this version, but allow newer versions as there is
already a pull request[1] to fix it, and I expect it will be included in
the next release.

Also fix the requirements job which was broken by
https://review.opendev.org/657890 adding a cap on Sphinx on Python 2.

[0] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/issues/488
[1] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/pull/489

Co-Authored-By: Jake Yip <jake.yip@unimelb.edu.au>

Task: 33401
Story: 2005740

Change-Id: I34dc36c5236debc42424073af2c2d2104e18179a
(cherry picked from commit 913636b6b1fdcdbcfed951ad1ca68a5f84f7b8e0)

[{'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-04-24 14:09:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-05-22 19:28:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-05-27 13:09:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

neutron-functional does not use devstack-vm-gate.sh, so that failure is unrelated to this patch'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-05-27 14:51:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

devstack-vm-gate.sh is used by the three neutron-grenade* tests.  So we can assess the impact of this change by seeing what happens with those tests.  These patches depend on this change:
https://review.opendev.org/#/q/topic:assess-655451
We can see what happens with the neutron-grenade* tests on them.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-05-28 13:09:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I ran the patches listed here:
https://review.opendev.org/#/q/topic:assess-655451
twice through the gate, for a total of 12 runs.

All of the grenade tests (which use the file modified on this patch) passed.

I left an analysis of the other test failures on each patch. Most are unrelated to Cinder.  Of the ones that were Cinder-related, none showed the issue that CINDER_PERIODIC_INTERVAL was introduced to address, namely, a failure to build volumes during tests (the Cinder scheduler thought it was out of capacity because deleted volumes weren't being added back to the capacity count quickly enough).

I think it's safe to merge this change and its dependency.  Let me know if there's anything else that should be looked at first."}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2019-05-28 13:56:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

I'm on the fence about making changes to devstack-gate now that it's basically frozen as legacy pre-zuul-v3 supporting infrastructure for DevStack jobs. Nevertheless, if this removal is considered generally safe and its existence has been triggering other bugs, then it may be an okay exception to the freeze."}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-05-28 14:03:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Jeremy: I'm OK with not making this change -- my main concern is to get the dependency merged.  If this patch isn't merged and the dependency is, the setting will be a no-op with devstack master, but will still work in pre-train devstacks.  I think that would be OK (though maybe I should change this patch to a comment about the other change?)"}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2019-05-29 08:28:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Yeah, I think that leaving the statement in for stability reasons and just adding a comment pointing towards the devstack change would be a better solution.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-05-29 19:25:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2019-06-04 07:09:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2019-06-04 15:21:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-24 14:09:06.000000000', 'message': 'Remove CINDER_PERIODIC_INTERVAL setting

Devstack allows setting the Cinder periodic_interval config option
via the CINDER_PERIODIC_INTERVAL shell var.  The dependency of this
patch removes the ability to set this via devstack, which means that
the Cinder periodic_interval will have its default value of 60.

The CINDER_PERIODIC_INTERVAL was introduced in devstack in havana as
a workaround for Bug #1180976.  That bug, however, was fixed in such
a way that it does not require adjusting the periodic_interval in
Cinder.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/652711
Change-Id: I7e2cc815ad14036dbae94e73d118b2845ddf5c64
Partial-bug: #1824837
'}, {'created': '2019-05-29 19:25:17.000000000', 'message': "Note status of CINDER_PERIODIC_INTERVAL setting

Change I1ef1fe564123216b19582262726cdb1078b7650e in DevStack removes
the ability to set the Cinder periodic_interval config option via the
CINDER_PERIODIC_INTERVAL shell var.

The CINDER_PERIODIC_INTERVAL was introduced in DevStack in Havana as
a workaround for Bug #1180976.  That bug, however, was fixed in such
a way that it does not require adjusting the periodic_interval in
Cinder, and the workaround was finally removed in Train.

Because devstack-gate is basically frozen as a legacy pre-zuul-v3
supporting infrastructure for DevStack jobs, this patch does not remove
setting the CINDER_PERIODIC_INTERVAL.  It simply adds a note explaining
that it's a no-op when using a Train or later DevStack.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/652711
Change-Id: I7e2cc815ad14036dbae94e73d118b2845ddf5c64
Partial-bug: #1824837
"}]
commit_message:
Note status of CINDER_PERIODIC_INTERVAL setting

Change I1ef1fe564123216b19582262726cdb1078b7650e in DevStack removes
the ability to set the Cinder periodic_interval config option via the
CINDER_PERIODIC_INTERVAL shell var.

The CINDER_PERIODIC_INTERVAL was introduced in DevStack in Havana as
a workaround for Bug #1180976.  That bug, however, was fixed in such
a way that it does not require adjusting the periodic_interval in
Cinder, and the workaround was finally removed in Train.

Because devstack-gate is basically frozen as a legacy pre-zuul-v3
supporting infrastructure for DevStack jobs, this patch does not remove
setting the CINDER_PERIODIC_INTERVAL.  It simply adds a note explaining
that it's a no-op when using a Train or later DevStack.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/652711
Change-Id: I7e2cc815ad14036dbae94e73d118b2845ddf5c64
Partial-bug: #1824837

subject: End support for changing cinder periodic_interval

[{'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-04-15 16:06:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2019-04-16 08:03:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

References to this var found via codesearch.openstack.org:

http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-dev/devstack/tree/.zuul.yaml#n383
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-infra/devstack-gate/tree/devstack-vm-gate.sh#n404
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/networking-midonet/tree/devstack/magnum/local.conf#n37

They all set the value to 10 instead of the default 60, not sure what the net effect on tests might be.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-04-16 13:22:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Jens: Thanks, I appreciate your help.  (I need to use codesearch more. 
 I only grepped in openstack-infra/openstack-zuul-jobs.)

Since this patch removed the ability for the local.conf to affect the Cinder periodic_interval setting, the devstack/.zuul.yaml#n383 isn't changing the value any more, so at least the devstack tests on this review were run with the cinder-configured default of 60.

I'll look into what jobs are affected by the other 2 occurrences you found."}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-04-24 13:42:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2019-04-29 10:32:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck dns timeout'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-05-22 19:28:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-05-24 17:34:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

neutron-tempest-linuxbridge failure is in a compute api image test unrelated to this patch.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-05-24 17:34:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-05-28 13:17:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

See reviews https://review.opendev.org/#/c/655451/ and https://review.opendev.org/#/c/655448/ for the other usage of devstack variable CINDER_PERIODIC_INTERVAL that Jens found.

The problematic one is https://review.opendev.org/#/c/655451/, which modifies devstack-gate/devstack-gate-vm.sh because it could potentially touch a lot of stuff.  Luckily, it's only used in legacy jobs and currrently in grenade tests.  So I ran the change through the gate 12 times to see what would happen, and the grenade tests passed each time.  See my comments on https://review.opendev.org/#/c/655451/ for details.  I think it's safe to merge this change."}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2019-05-29 08:29:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2019-06-04 07:09:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-06-04 13:05:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

The openstack-tox-docs failure looks similar to https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-gate/+bug/1831474 except that the problem is happening during update apt cache instead of during pip install.

devstack-platform-centos-7 is a weird one, the testrunner gives a summary and then a bunch of thread {0} results suddenly show up:
http://logs.openstack.org/11/652711/2/check/devstack-platform-centos-7/f7c1bdd/job-output.txt.gz#_2019-05-24_20_59_21_782533'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-06-04 13:05:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}]

commit_message:
End support for changing cinder periodic_interval

Support for changing the cinder periodic_interval config option
was added way back in havana as a workaround for bug #1180976
by change I20e52e66fcc94b224476cdd14c88bd6981b4e617.  As the fix
for that bug does not require modifying this config value, and
such modification may have unintentional adverse effects, end
the support.

Change-Id: I1ef1fe564123216b19582262726cdb1078b7650e
Partial-bug: #1824837

commit_message:
sqlalchemy: GroupTypeProjects.deleted is boolean

And hence does not support read_deleted="int_no"

Change-Id: Id78801854b4700583b0198df0632000cddc261d1
Signed-off-by: Sven Wegener <sven.wegener@inovex.de>

[{'created': '2019-04-09 16:15:52.000000000', 'message': "db: Remove cell APIs

These are no longer needed. We can't actually remove the 'cells' table
yet (that has to wait another release or two) but a TODO is added to
ensure this eventually happens.

The 'CellExists' and 'CellNotFound' exceptions, which were only raised
by these APIs, are removed.

Part of blueprint remove-cells-v1

Change-Id: Ibc402b446c9b92ce03a1dd98f41ec6cf5db20642
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
db: Remove cell APIs

These are no longer needed. We can't actually remove the 'cells' table
yet (that has to wait another release or two) but a TODO is added to
ensure this eventually happens.

The 'CellExists' and 'CellNotFound' exceptions, which were only raised
by these APIs, are removed.

Part of blueprint remove-cells-v1

Change-Id: Ibc402b446c9b92ce03a1dd98f41ec6cf5db20642
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-04 01:01:08.000000000', 'message': "Workaround missing RequestSpec.instance_group.uuid

It's clear that we could have a RequestSpec.instance_group
without a uuid field if the InstanceGroup is set from the
_populate_group_info method which should only be used for
legacy translation of request specs using legacy filter
properties dicts.

To workaround the issue, we look for the group scheduler hint
to get the group uuid before loading it from the DB.

The related functional regression recreate test is updated
to show this solves the issue.

Change-Id: I20981c987549eec40ad9762e74b0db16e54f4e63
Closes-Bug: #1830747
(cherry picked from commit da453c2bfe86ab7a825f0aa7ebced15886f7a5fd)
"}]
commit_message:
Workaround missing RequestSpec.instance_group.uuid

It's clear that we could have a RequestSpec.instance_group
without a uuid field if the InstanceGroup is set from the
_populate_group_info method which should only be used for
legacy translation of request specs using legacy filter
properties dicts.

To workaround the issue, we look for the group scheduler hint
to get the group uuid before loading it from the DB.

The related functional regression recreate test is updated
to show this solves the issue.

Change-Id: I20981c987549eec40ad9762e74b0db16e54f4e63
Closes-Bug: #1830747
(cherry picked from commit da453c2bfe86ab7a825f0aa7ebced15886f7a5fd)

Implement Security Context for Nova

 - Nova server deployment

commit_message:
Allow regular expressions in skip-list

This allows you to more easily skip tests belonging to particular class,
as you don't have to list them individually.

Backwards compatability is maintained by treating invalid regexes
as literal strings.

Change-Id: I10d7477cd3321683899d455bf4370ec8ef8a4d05

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-27 13:32:24.000000000', 'message': "DNM: check I7e2cc815ad14036dbae94e73d118b2845ddf5c64

The above referenced change removes setting a Cinder config option to
a non-default value in devstack-vm-gate.sh.  The option was exposed
in devstack to fix a problem back in Havana that was causing gate
failures, but the issue was ultimately fixed in such a way that the
change to the default periodic job interval that the setting adjusts
is not required.

We don't want to leave the setting exposed in devstack because it
no longer does exactly what it did in Havana.  See bug #1824837 for
details.

The parent of this patch removes the modification of the setting from
devstack-vm-gate.sh.  That file is used mostly by legacy (pre-Zuul-3)
jobs and currently these check jobs:
* neutron-grenade-multinode
* neutron-grenade-dvr-multinode

The point of this patch is to run those jobs multiple times to give
us some confidence that removing the exposed Cinder option will not
negatively impact jobs currently using it.

Change-Id: I17d4bffc36a732edc7925f36c069045158834e84
Partial-bug: #1824837
"}]
commit_message:
DNM: check I7e2cc815ad14036dbae94e73d118b2845ddf5c64

The above referenced change removes setting a Cinder config option to
a non-default value in devstack-vm-gate.sh.  The option was exposed
in devstack to fix a problem back in Havana that was causing gate
failures, but the issue was ultimately fixed in such a way that the
change to the default periodic job interval that the setting adjusts
is not required.

We don't want to leave the setting exposed in devstack because it
no longer does exactly what it did in Havana.  See bug #1824837 for
details.

The parent of this patch removes the modification of the setting from
devstack-vm-gate.sh.  That file is used mostly by legacy (pre-Zuul-3)
jobs and currently these check jobs:
* neutron-grenade-multinode
* neutron-grenade-dvr-multinode

The point of this patch is to run those jobs multiple times to give
us some confidence that removing the exposed Cinder option will not
negatively impact jobs currently using it.

Change-Id: I17d4bffc36a732edc7925f36c069045158834e84
Partial-bug: #1824837

DNM: check I7e2cc815ad14036dbae94e73d118b2845ddf5c64

The above referenced change removes setting a Cinder config option to
a non-default value in devstack-vm-gate.sh.  The option was exposed
in devstack to fix a problem back in Havana that was causing gate
failures, but the issue was ultimately fixed in such a way that the
change to the default periodic job interval that the setting adjusts
is not required.

We don't want to leave the setting exposed in devstack because it
no longer does exactly what it did in Havana.  See bug #1824837 for
details.

The parent of this patch removes the modification of the setting from
devstack-vm-gate.sh.  That file is used mostly by legacy (pre-Zuul-3)
jobs and currently these check jobs:
* neutron-grenade-multinode
* neutron-grenade-dvr-multinode

The point of this patch is to run those jobs multiple times to give
us some confidence that removing the exposed Cinder option will not
negatively impact jobs currently using it.

Change-Id: Ia9ef6c40a95e98f734f102f93658e7ce14a54097

subject: Enable func-names
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5623, 'name': 'David Lyle', 'email': 'dklyle0@gmail.com', 'username': 'david-lyle'}, {'_account_id': 7665, 'name': 'Travis Tripp', 'email': 'os.travis.tripp@gmail.com', 'username': 'travis.tripp'}, {'_account_id': 8735, 'name': 'Vitaly Kramskikh', 'email': 'vkramskikh@mirantis.com', 'username': 'vkramskikh'}, {'_account_id': 9622, 'name': 'Cindy Lu', 'email': 'clu@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'clu14'}, {'_account_id': 9717, 'name': 'Michael Krotscheck', 'email': 'krotscheck@gmail.com', 'username': 'krotscheck'}, {'_account_id': 12071, 'name': 'Richard Jones', 'email': 'r1chardj0n3s@gmail.com', 'username': 'richard'}, {'_account_id': 13805, 'name': 'Shaoquan Chen', 'email': 'sean.chen2@hp.com', 'username': 'SeanChen'}, {'_account_id': 14124, 'name': 'Matt Borland', 'email': 'matt.borland@hpe.com', 'username': 'mborland'}, {'_account_id': 15742, 'name': 'Paulo Ewerton Gomes Fragoso', 'email': 'pauloewerton@lsd.ufcg.edu.br', 'username': 'pauloewerton'}, {'_account_id': 16628, 'name': 'Beth Elwell', 'email': 'e.r.elwell@gmail.com', 'username': 'bethelwell'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 15742, 'date': '2015-11-11 18:10:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-11-11 19:26:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified-1

Build failed (check pipeline).  For information on how to proceed, see http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html#automated-testing

- gate-eslint-config-openstack-npm-run-lint http://logs.openstack.org/57/244257/1/check/gate-eslint-config-openstack-npm-run-lint/7db1399/ : FAILURE in 1m 32s
- gate-eslint-config-openstack-npm-run-test http://logs.openstack.org/57/244257/1/check/gate-eslint-config-openstack-npm-run-test/f52661a/ : SUCCESS in 1m 29s'}, {'account_id': 14124, 'date': '2015-11-12 16:15:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

How do we want to handle lint resolution?  Should it be a separate patch preceding this one, or should it be incorporated into this patch?'}, {'account_id': 14124, 'date': '2015-11-12 16:20:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Wow, when running this option on my system (npm run lint), the process hangs as it uses an inordinate amount of memory and compute.  Seems like a bad algorithm.'}, {'account_id': 9717, 'date': '2015-11-17 16:41:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Lint resolution should happen in the patch itself. As for memory concerns... maybe the eslint upgrade patch will help?'}, {'account_id': 9717, 'date': '2015-11-17 17:59:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 9717, 'date': '2015-11-17 18:01:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I've updated the patch so that it'll pass tests, so we can have a discussion on whether this rule make sense. My own comments are below."}, {'account_id': 9717, 'date': '2015-11-17 18:06:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I, personally, am undecided about this rule. On one side, the ability to debug easier is nice. On the other, adding function names for foreach loops and other iterators seems too heavy handed.'}, {'account_id': 9717, 'date': '2015-11-17 18:06:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-11-17 18:28:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-eslint-config-openstack-npm-run-lint http://logs.openstack.org/57/244257/2/check/gate-eslint-config-openstack-npm-run-lint/2687db1/ : SUCCESS in 1m 35s
- gate-eslint-config-openstack-npm-run-test http://logs.openstack.org/57/244257/2/check/gate-eslint-config-openstack-npm-run-test/aa3c7be/ : SUCCESS in 1m 43s'}, {'account_id': 13805, 'date': '2015-11-17 20:09:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Michael, I agree with you. This might be considered as good practice rather than a rule. For small functions that works as a lambda this should be totally ok without name, resulting cleaner code. I don't think that in this case it will cause debugging harder."}, {'account_id': 9717, 'date': '2015-11-18 20:04:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

An additional note I found on stackoverflow: there appears to be a concrete benefit to using function declaration in loops. 

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/28093569/is-it-more-performant-to-write-named-functions-in-node-js'}, {'account_id': 8688, 'date': '2015-11-24 10:25:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

IMO debugging is super important and anything that can help is worthwhile. If you must, you can use single-letter names for trivial functions.'}, {'account_id': 9717, 'date': '2015-11-24 16:45:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Soft +1. The more I think about it, the more I think this'll be useful overall. It's going to be a hard update for existing projects, because it's such a common pattern."}, {'account_id': 12071, 'date': '2015-11-25 00:35:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I'm a soft -1 on this; I think the impact on existing projects will be great as anonymous functions are very commonly accepted practise. There would be a slight benefit to debugging, but I think the cost outweighs that."}, {'account_id': 9717, 'date': '2015-11-25 16:04:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Some back story- apparently this rule came up because during horizon reviews, anonymous functions were found manually and downvoted. Turning it into an automatic check was proposed.'}, {'account_id': 9717, 'date': '2015-11-25 16:08:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Brief test indicates about 2000 violations in horizon's dashboard code alone, not to mention the other javascript projects.

I'm ok putting this rule in if it's done proactively - that is, the rule is activated in horizon, the violations are handled, and then we push that rule upstream into the global rules. Paulo, will that work for you?"}, {'account_id': 15742, 'date': '2015-11-30 12:53:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@Michael

Yes, that'll work for me. The change to the existing code seems a little too daunting, but I'm willing to help get it done.

Otherwise, I think that maybe we could try to agree on something like having anonymous functions only in simpler code such as foreach loops and one-liner promise handlers."}, {'account_id': 7665, 'date': '2015-11-30 18:53:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I'm in favor of this rule as I like the premise and I do get sick of the amount of reviews where we are manually catching this (it is part of the John Papa style guide).  However, I cringe a bit about upheaving the whole codebase over it and it would be a really low priority with a lot possible merge conflicts."}, {'account_id': 9717, 'date': '2015-12-02 16:00:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@Travis- We may be able to run linting rules across only the files changed in the last commit. The gist here doesn't quite work correctly (it needs HEAD~1), but it's a great example of how that might be accomplished.

https://gist.github.com/oroce/11282380"}, {'account_id': 9717, 'date': '2015-12-02 18:43:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Ok, so I'm upgrading my vote to a +2. After disabling this rule for legacy horizon, only ~800 violations occurred. Also, the general consensus here seems to be "We like this rule, but we're intimidated by the work necessary". 

Whether the rule is a good idea, and how we could best migrate our codebase to be compliant, are two distinct problems, and the latter is something better addressed by the project itself.'}, {'account_id': 8735, 'date': '2016-01-15 08:55:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Hi, I'd prefer not to add this rule for 2 reasons:

1) I think there is very little value in function naming, but it add significant burden for developers

2) There is a bug with named functions shadowing in Safari: https://github.com/indutny/node-ip/pull/47"}, {'account_id': 9717, 'date': '2016-01-15 13:28:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

@Paulo - at this point, it doesn't look like you're going to get the necessary consensus to land this rule without directly addressing Richard, Sean, and VItaly's concerns. For reference, this repository requires five +1 votes, with no -1 votes, to land any rule."}, {'account_id': 16628, 'date': '2016-01-15 13:29:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Agreed that a lot of work will be involved in changing it and that is pretty hefty. In the long run though, making this change for the better is very worthwhile IMO. In addition to what has already been said, naming functions is good for documentation and understanding what the general purpose of the function is and therefore makes it easier to initialise new contributors into the project.'}, {'account_id': 15742, 'date': '2016-01-15 14:34:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I think the most reasonable argument I could make in favor of this rule is that, well, it's in the style guide. Enforcing it through eslint should, IMHO, be faced as a convenience for reviewers rather than a burden. Otherwise, patches will probably continue to get -1'd.

As for Richard, Sean and Vitaly's concerns I can only directly cite the style guide which states that using named functions instead of anonymous "produces more readable code, is much easier to debug, and reduces the amount of nested callback code" (https://github.com/johnpapa/angular-styleguide#style-y024). Maybe we could further discuss if that's really the case. In case of the Safari bug, I'm unsure whether Safari is a Horizon supported browser.

Of course, there's this concern about the impact on existing Horizon code, but as Michael very well noticed that is different from discussing the actual usefulness of the rule.'}, {'account_id': 9717, 'date': '2016-01-15 15:31:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Safari is not Apache licensed, and is therefore not an OpenStack supported browser. we support what we test, meaning Firefox and Chromium.'}, {'account_id': 12281, 'date': '2016-02-29 17:09:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

After reading the page on eslint about this rule and the attached link to a deeper explanation on the same page, I do think this is quite useful for debugging purposes and specially with a lot more of angular code getting into horizon, this will be really useful to pinpoint the actual function failing instead of the useless "anonymous function" failure.
Will probably be a lot of work sure, but with the rate of new angular code getting it, this will help in the long term.'}, {'account_id': 8735, 'date': '2016-03-01 08:35:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I think with the modern developer tools "anonymous functions" aren't a problem anymore. Also, in the long term everybody is going to switch to arrow functions for callbacks. There is already ESLint rule for this: http://eslint.org/docs/rules/prefer-arrow-callback'}, {'account_id': 16628, 'date': '2016-03-01 16:00:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

updating my +1 to +2 on this patch for same reasons as +1 earlier'}, {'account_id': 16628, 'date': '2016-03-01 16:00:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14124, 'date': '2016-03-01 16:18:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I'm not a big fan of merging this right before the end of the release.  I generally do want us to name functions but there is a lot of code that doesn't do this right now."}, {'account_id': 14124, 'date': '2016-03-01 16:19:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I definitely don't want this enforced on tests.  Tests use anonymous features all the time, and they are not a debugging issue there."}, {'account_id': 11778, 'date': '2016-03-01 16:22:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 16628, 'date': '2016-03-01 17:12:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

Good point made wr tests. Withdrawing +2 until suitable compromise put in place'}, {'account_id': 12071, 'date': '2016-03-01 20:39:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

FWIW I've ben getting into the habit of naming all my test functions (they're all called "test") and I've actually found it slightly improves test debugging at very little cost.

I've also seen the benefit in a lot of other code. So a big +1 from me.'}, {'account_id': 9717, 'date': '2016-03-28 18:09:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-05-18 16:23:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified-1

Merge Failed.

This change or one of its cross-repo dependencies was unable to be automatically merged with the current state of its repository. Please rebase the change and upload a new patchset.'}, {'account_id': 15742, 'date': '2016-06-08 16:59:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 5623, 'date': '2016-06-08 18:51:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 9717, 'date': '2016-06-08 19:04:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-06-08 20:11:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-eslint-config-openstack-npm-run-lint http://logs.openstack.org/57/244257/3/check/gate-eslint-config-openstack-npm-run-lint/3e51151/ : SUCCESS in 12m 18s
- gate-eslint-config-openstack-npm-run-test http://logs.openstack.org/57/244257/3/check/gate-eslint-config-openstack-npm-run-test/08c09f8/ : SUCCESS in 13m 09s'}, {'account_id': 16628, 'date': '2017-02-23 16:22:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

There have been no further updates on this for a while with us at a bit of a stalemate. I would suggest that we add a wishlist bug to horizon and indeed to any other projects we are involved with for which this will have a large impact. Currently, there are much higher priority bugs to work on in horizon without having to redirect our efforts to changing a whole load of functions, however as and when someone wants some fairly easy but hefty work to get through or we get to the point where we have addressed all the high priority bugs (heh) and get to this one, we can re-look at enabling this and ensuring future best practices. 

In the meantime 3 points: 

1) I will look into the documentation surrounding function naming and add some re best practices for naming _all_ functions 

2) should we consider -1'ing patches that do not use function naming so this situation does not get even worse? 

3) do we now abandon this patch with the plan to link to it in the wishlist bug so that once addressed we re-open this patch? 

Thoughts?"}]

messages:
[{'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2019-05-04 16:31:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2019-05-04 17:08:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

need to add a tag, but what tag?'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2019-05-04 18:28:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> need to add a tag, but what tag?

we have to define it. Something like "validation".
I've also heard the need of a less generic tag, meaning we might want something like:
tags:
  - validations
  - validations-<service> (in your case, validations-ceph)

That will allow to either exclude all the validations (--skip-tags validations) or exclude only validations for a specific service (--skip-tags validations-ceph for instance)

Does it make any sense? If so, I can update the current doc change content in order to point that good practice.'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2019-05-04 21:14:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Looks like it worked:

http://logs.openstack.org/31/657131/1/check/tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario001-standalone/76e56b1/logs/undercloud/home/zuul/undercloud-ansible-uELtbD/ansible.log.txt.gz#_2019-05-04_17_10_26_911'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2019-05-04 21:24:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2019-05-04 21:26:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> > need to add a tag, but what tag?
 > 
 > we have to define it. Something like "validation".
 > I've also heard the need of a less generic tag, meaning we might
 > want something like:
 > tags:
 > - validations
 > - validations-<service> (in your case, validations-ceph)
 > 
 > That will allow to either exclude all the validations (--skip-tags
 > validations) or exclude only validations for a specific service
 > (--skip-tags validations-ceph for instance)
 > 
 > Does it make any sense? If so, I can update the current doc change
 > content in order to point that good practice.

This makes sense to me. I've updated to do the above in patchset 2.

@EmilienM: what do you think of the above convention for tagging?'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2019-05-05 12:22:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2019-05-05 17:23:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@John: I've just had a look in python-tripleoclient, apparently there's a "validation" ansible tag already. Maybe that's the one we should use, at least for the "global" one? Have to check that a bit further, will probably send an email to the community ML in order to get feedbacks.

@Emilien: any idea maybe?'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2019-05-05 18:22:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2019-05-07 14:37:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Ensure ceph-ansible is installed

Before attempting to install Ceph check that ceph-ansible is
installed using the new inflight-validations feature. If it
is not installed then fail the deployment using the message
from the validations frame work.

Change-Id: I6e9042f8cc2e5258e0e62c1bacaebf9a51eb61a7
Implements: blueprint inflight-validations
Depends-On: Ic099c61c74abf6da24a2cce899c944e3bf8ce26b

subject: Have a separate s3api functional test suite
messages:
[{'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-05-13 21:03:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-05-18 04:26:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2019-05-23 20:04:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

All these tests are failing for me, I'm having some kind of configuration problem...

In my proxy config I have:

	[filter:tempauth]
	use = egg:swift#tempauth
	user_admin_admin = admin .admin .reseller_admin
	user_test_tester = testing .admin
	user_test_tester2 = testing2 .admin
	user_test_tester3 = testing3
	user_test2_tester2 = testing2 .admin

... and in my test.conf I've added:

	[s3api_test]
	endpoint = http://saio:8080
	access_key1 = test:tester
	secret_key1 = testing
	access_key2 = test:tester2
	secret_key2 = testing2
	access_key3 = test:tester3
	secret_key3 = testing3

But I'm getting either AccessDenied or something about the bucket listing not working.

Maybe worse I have no idea how to map all these required access secrets to users on my for-realzy aws account!?

If we simplify this to start and just do one user and then start porting func.s3api tests to boto3 under this new suite - how far do you think we can get before we need to add these additional accounts?"}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-05-24 16:32:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hmm... I wonder if that's related to https://review.opendev.org/#/c/660196/ ..."}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-05-24 20:26:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Nope! Never mind -- that's unrelated.

Since we're explicitly targeting S3's API, we have to be more opinionated about our s3api config. Try setting

 s3_acl = True
 check_bucket_owner = True

I'll have to update the commit message to reflect that."}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2019-06-04 16:48:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

That worked, thanks Tim!

Good to go with vsaio:

https://github.com/swiftstack/vagrant-swift-all-in-one/commit/39962df3ee46c646c7cdb5a633602467cfb7b731

Hopefully next person can figure it out more easily:

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/663098/1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-13 21:03:12.000000000', 'message': "Have a separate s3api functional test suite

The idea is that we should have a suite of pure-S3 tests that we can
point at AWS to verify that we've written accurate tests, then point at
Swift-with-s3api to verify that we've correctly implemented the S3 api.

As a start, just check GET Service; go ahead and create a few buckets
so we can see them in the service listing.

Change-Id: I283757cd3084b1c83a1e9bf0f46b6ce9d7ee8eb9
"}]
commit_message:
Have a separate s3api functional test suite

The idea is that we should have a suite of pure-S3 tests that we can
point at AWS to verify that we've written accurate tests, then point at
Swift-with-s3api to verify that we've correctly implemented the S3 api.

As a start, just check GET Service; go ahead and create a few buckets
so we can see them in the service listing.

Change-Id: I283757cd3084b1c83a1e9bf0f46b6ce9d7ee8eb9

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-31 10:54:42.000000000', 'message': 'Fix metadata agent proxy list updates race condition

When multiple instances are being spawned and/or teared down at the
same time, multiple updates to the "neutron-metadata-proxy-networks"
list may race each other resulting in some networks UUIDs to go missing
in that process.

One of the problems with these updates is that the external_ids column
in the OVSDBs only supports string type values so, the "list" is an
actual comma-separated string. In order to add or remove an item from
from it the code in networking-ovn needs to transform it from and back
to string and commit the whole thing to OVN database when saving it.

When it races, one commit may overwrite each other.

In order to fix this problem this patch is adding a file lock on the
method that manipulates this list and commit it to the database. It's
important to note that the metadata agent only updates the Chassis entry
which it's currently running on, therefore we do not need a distributed
lock (the file lock, being local works).

I was able to reproduce this problem fairly consistently by concurrently
spawning 50 instances each time with BrowBeat (see bug ticket for more
information). After this fix was applied I could attest that the problem
was resolved.

This patch also changes the level of the log stating that metadata service
isn't ready (it waits for the network id to show up in the proxy list)
from WARNING to ERROR because at least in the experience I had in the lab,
once that happens, the VMs are inaccessible.

Change-Id: Idc7bae88ed6f3ec44541b38f559a0296d2159449
Closes-Bug: #1831224
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
'}, {'created': '2019-05-31 11:48:12.000000000', 'message': 'Fix metadata agent proxy list updates race condition

commit_message:
Fix metadata agent proxy list updates race condition

When multiple instances are being spawned and/or teared down at the
same time, multiple updates to the "neutron-metadata-proxy-networks"
list may race each other resulting in some networks UUIDs to go missing
in that process.

One of the problems with these updates is that the external_ids column
in the OVSDBs only supports string type values so, the "list" is an
actual comma-separated string. In order to add or remove an item from
from it the code in networking-ovn needs to transform it from and back
to string and commit the whole thing to OVN database when saving it.

When it races, commits may overwrite each other.

In order to fix this problem this patch is adding a file lock on the
method that manipulates this list and commit it to the database. It's
important to note that the metadata agent only updates the Chassis entry
which it's currently running on, therefore we do not need a distributed
lock (the file lock, being local works).

I was able to reproduce this problem fairly consistently by concurrently
spawning 50 instances each time with BrowBeat (see bug ticket for more
information). After this fix was applied I could attest that the problem
was resolved.

Change-Id: Idc7bae88ed6f3ec44541b38f559a0296d2159449
Closes-Bug: #1831224
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add service_domain_id to the auto_accessors list.

service_domain_id might be required by dependant charms
such as aodh and should be exposed as an accessor attribute.

Partial-Bug: #1831181

Signed-off-by: Jorge Niedbalski <jorge.niedbalski@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Use list instead of six.viewkeys to avoid py2 to py3 problems

This change fixes an 'RuntimeError: dictionary changed size during
iteration' error that is raised because of different behaviour between
python2 and python3.  An earlier attempt [1] to use the six library did
not fix the issue.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/660427

Resolves-Bug: #1829304
Change-Id: Ic4c5790a5d66e10a606327f4f4e4c92611f161d8
(cherry picked from commit a65ae9c81eea909133446c0be4d54ce389f6e0e1)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-27 08:37:57.000000000', 'message': 'Do not set port addresses on LSP while port not bound

FIP that points to VIP port could not have addresses
specified [1]. Router pipeline will try to resolve
ARP requests internally from LSP instead looking for
actual MAC address from LSP where VIP exists at this moment.

Lets not set this address till the port is bound.

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1707241

Change-Id: I36261701be393584ad4b00ced96273736339b03c
Closes-Bug: #1789686
(cherry picked from commit 33fd553158a96b4dc40c66acf050fa7f91227dec)
'}]
commit_message:
Do not set port addresses on LSP while port not bound

FIP that points to VIP port could not have addresses
specified [1]. Router pipeline will try to resolve
ARP requests internally from LSP instead looking for
actual MAC address from LSP where VIP exists at this moment.

Lets not set this address till the port is bound.

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1707241

Change-Id: I36261701be393584ad4b00ced96273736339b03c
Closes-Bug: #1789686
(cherry picked from commit 33fd553158a96b4dc40c66acf050fa7f91227dec)

commit_message:
Fix custom network.name_lower in krb-service-principals

The lowercase network names was hardcoded to 'external',
'internal_api' and 'storage_mgmt'. Use jinja to get the
network.name_lower value from network_data.yaml instead
so that users can customize the lowercase network name.

Handle service_net_map_replace in the jinja2 logic so that
service_net_map_replace works for both default networks and
custom networks.

Enables a user either to change 'name_lower' of a network
and overriding the ServiceNetMap accordingly, as well as
user changeing 'name_lower' and use 'service_net_map_replace'
so that the default ServiceNetMap can be used.

Closes-Bug: #1830852
Change-Id: Ie9bd482782ff770d90dfc38a585237812ed81c06
(cherry picked from commit c0fcf8674d5f7c5c0cec1179fa56ef4536d5c5fb)
(cherry picked from commit f708ab7a827cc0db211b4709447f77126087347e)

commit_message:
Fix custom network.name_lower in krb-service-principals

The lowercase network names was hardcoded to 'external',
'internal_api' and 'storage_mgmt'. Use jinja to get the
network.name_lower value from network_data.yaml instead
so that users can customize the lowercase network name.

Handle service_net_map_replace in the jinja2 logic so that
service_net_map_replace works for both default networks and
custom networks.

Enables a user either to change 'name_lower' of a network
and overriding the ServiceNetMap accordingly, as well as
user changeing 'name_lower' and use 'service_net_map_replace'
so that the default ServiceNetMap can be used.

Closes-Bug: #1830852
Change-Id: Ie9bd482782ff770d90dfc38a585237812ed81c06
(cherry picked from commit c0fcf8674d5f7c5c0cec1179fa56ef4536d5c5fb)
(cherry picked from commit f708ab7a827cc0db211b4709447f77126087347e)

deployed in the openstack namespace, and the mariadb exporter
user for the openstack mariadb instance

The lowercase network names was hardcoded to 'external',
'internal_api' and 'storage_mgmt'. Use jinja to get the
network.name_lower value from network_data.yaml instead
so that users can customize the lowercase network name.

Handle service_net_map_replace in the jinja2 logic so that

commit_message:
Fix custom network.name_lower in krb-service-principals

The lowercase network names was hardcoded to 'external',
'internal_api' and 'storage_mgmt'. Use jinja to get the
network.name_lower value from network_data.yaml instead
so that users can customize the lowercase network name.

Handle service_net_map_replace in the jinja2 logic so that
service_net_map_replace works for both default networks and
custom networks.

Enables a user either to change 'name_lower' of a network
and overriding the ServiceNetMap accordingly, as well as
user changeing 'name_lower' and use 'service_net_map_replace'
so that the default ServiceNetMap can be used.

Closes-Bug: #1830852
Change-Id: Ie9bd482782ff770d90dfc38a585237812ed81c06
(cherry picked from commit c0fcf8674d5f7c5c0cec1179fa56ef4536d5c5fb)
(cherry picked from commit f708ab7a827cc0db211b4709447f77126087347e)
